about.title: Let's go out and explore the world with hiking
about.description:
Shecanhike is a project born from a passion for hiking, culture, and the wild beauty of our planet. It's a celebration of women's curiosity and strength on the trailwhere every step connects us to history, landscapes, and ourselves.

Whether close to home or while traveling, shecanhike encourages women to explore their surroundings through hiking. We believe that the best way to understand a placeits culture, stories, people and spiritis by walking through it.

community.title: Why you should join our community for hiking
community.description:
Shecanhike is more than a hiking projectâ€”it's a community built on sisterhood, support, and shared adventure.

Whether you're exploring trails close to home or hiking through unfamiliar landscapes while traveling, you're never truly walking alone. This space is here to connect women who hike, offering encouragement, real stories, and trusted advice to help each other feel confident and safe on the trail.

In a world where solo exploration can feel daunting, shecanhike is about walking togetherâ€”lifting each other up, celebrating our journeys, and creating a network where every step is supported.

about.title: Who is behind SheCanHike ?
about.subtitle: Learn more about us
about.description:
Hi, Iâ€™m Marie. I created She Can Hike to bring women together through hiking. I wanted to meet other women who love being outdoors, to share moments of simplicity and connection.

Hiking helps me clear my mind and ease my anxiety. Iâ€™m someone who tends to overthink, worry about the future, and doubt myself constantly. But when Iâ€™m out on the trail, all those thoughts quiet down. I feel confident â€” like Iâ€™m exactly where Iâ€™m meant to be. The rhythm of my steps, the sound of the wind, the smell of the forestâ€¦ it all brings me back to the present moment.

I'm not great at expressing myself with words, so hiking has become its own kind of therapy for me â€” my stress relief, my source of inspiration, a reminder that not everything is lost, and that nature itself is powerful despite how small our existence can feel.

Traveling is another big passion of mine. Over the years, Iâ€™ve lived in six different countries. Iâ€™ve learned that the best way to understand a place is often to walk through it â€” to take the small paths, visit the remote villages, and meet people whose traditions have stayed alive for generations. Hiking lets you do exactly that.

I do enjoy cities for their social side, but I can quickly feel overwhelmed by how fast everything moves. I feel like Iâ€™m always a few steps behind. When Iâ€™m hiking, all of that fades away. Thereâ€™s no rush, no comparison, no noise. Itâ€™s one of the rare moments when I truly live in the present.

Thatâ€™s what She Can Hike is all about â€” slowing down, connecting with nature, and reminding ourselves of how strong and capable we truly are. I do hope this community will help each other grow, lift one another up, and find comfort in knowing weâ€™re not walking this journey alone.
